page.title: 01In and around Lacock
page.content: Lacock is in the north of Wiltshire. It is near Melksham, Corsham and Chippenham. The{River Avon}runs through Lacock and it is quite deep. It is a nice peaceful village and lots of{tourists}come to visit it. They come to see the{abbey, the church, the {lock-up, the National Trust shop and {the tithe barn. The National Trust looks after the village. There are quite a lot of pubs and a few shops. There are tea-rooms opposite the Red Lion. This is a very rural area that relies heavily on{tourism.}Amenities in the area are for the tourists and there is little provision for the inhabitants themselves.
